title: Colombia Public Signage
content:
I need to know what is the official typeface used for [colombian road signs](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101071406/http:/pieroglina.de/bogota.jpg).

The typefaces »Interstate« and »Highway Gothic« are quite similar, but I need to know the official one. For example like »DIN«, which is used for road signage in Germany.

Thanks a lot!
author: piero101

comments.content: It looks like Interstate to me.

You can try asking [Ralf Herrmann](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101071406/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/ralf_herrmann/sets/72157603678544449/) or [Andrea Bergamini](http://web.archive.org/web/20131101071406/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/abergamini/2317950549/). They might know.

It's certainly based on the FHWA series fonts, But it looks like it was redrawn.  
I don't think you will find a digital font that matches this one exactly.

Thanks Ralf, guess I have to do this by myself.  
I already started to draw the lower case g to get this rough look.  
Especially the B looks quite nice – pretty DIY ;)
You might use the free Roadgeek fonts as a starting point.
Nice collection, thanks for the advice!
